result.execSummary:
The defendant RAMON A TILSON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for both the Substance Abuse Program and the Challenge Incarceration Program. See below for credit for time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Bond applied to Fine and Costs.  Paid in Full.  Balance returned to Surety.

9:30 AM Defendant RAMON A TILSON in court, in custody.  Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court for RAMON A TILSON.  Prosecuting attorney Stephanie Ann Stauber Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi recites joint recommendation of 36 month prison term.  State confirms agreement.  Parties waive right to Presentence Investigation Report. Defendant advised of and waives rights.  Enters plea freely and voluntarily and proceeds to sentencing.  Victim/Witness rights complied with.   Sentencing arguments made by parties.  Stipulation to 21 days sentence credit.
